alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Monroe and south central Cumberland Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 650 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Celina, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Monroe and south central Cumberland Counties, including the following locations... Littrell, Peytonsburg, Stalcup, Kettle, Raydure, Tanbark, Judio, Ellington, Vernon and Ashlock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
